pull_request.title: Do not pass NoneType as argument to ceph_crush_rule
pull_request.body:
With ansible-core 2.15 it is not possible to pass argument of unexpected
type, as otherwise module will fail with:
`'None' is not a string and conversion is not allowed`

With that we want to only get all existing crush rules, so we can simply
supply an empty string as a name argument, which would satisfy
requirements and have same behaviour for previous ansible versions.

Alternative approach would be to stop making `name` as a required
argument to the module and use empty string as default value
when info state is used.

issue.title: Dashboard meters broken
issue.body:
**Bug Report**

What happened:

most monitoring meters on dashboard return
"parse error at line *, char *: missing unit character in duration"
while some work correctly

**Environment**:
* OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): AlmaLinux 8.8 mgr/monitoring, AlmaLinux 9.2 osd/mon
* Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`):
* Docker version if applicable (e.g. `docker version`): distro podman
* Ansible version (e.g. `ansible-playbook --version`): 2.12
* ceph-ansible version (e.g. `git head or tag or stable branch`): master
* Ceph version (e.g. `ceph -v`): reef

![Screenshot from 2023-10-24 15-29-08](https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/assets/1597304/4052bfea-4659-4b97-98d0-832aab4bfa29)

issue.title: Is it possible to have unequal return values for begin() and end() when the unordered_map container is empty?
issue.body: When clearing the fd_map container, the container is already empty and still enters the for loop , not sure why. For C++ unordered_map container, if the container is empty, will begin!=end exist? If so, how to avoid it?

commits.message:
osd: drop filestore support

filestore objectstore will be gone in the next Ceph release.the
This drops the filestore support in ceph-ansible.

Signed-off-by: Guillaume Abrioux <gabrioux@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 896d82877fec586e76561720761b31cc9a4b68d5)

tests: test nfs-ganesha with stable repos

dev repos are broken, let's test with stable builds for now.

Signed-off-by: Guillaume Abrioux <gabrioux@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 15b91962e7ed0993b34b81d3cf61dbb54239adfb)

update: fix mgr upgrade issue

for some reason, this task has to be done in 2 steps otherwise it fails.
1/ stop and disable the service
2/ mask it

when done with with a single task, the module says the service has been
stopped while this isn't the case (Ansible systemd module bug?).

it possibly relates to https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/68680

Signed-off-by: Guillaume Abrioux <gabrioux@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 5cd692dcdc8dd55036b8c283f1bca56f79965c1d)

purge: remove /var/lib/ceph

This directory should be removed when the cluster is purged.
most of the services are started with the `--security-opt label=disable`
option. If the directory is not removed, it can cause SElinux issues
when the cluster is redeployed.

Signed-off-by: Guillaume Abrioux <gabrioux@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 23a8bbc6c59d78e982f343c06cfb5fe8e86cb757)
